marketNews.title: BNGA 2024: Net Profit +5.4% YoY, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) recorded a net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+7.6% YoY, -1.9% QoQ). This result means the net profit for 2024 grew +5.4% YoY to 6.8 trillion rupiah, in line with expectations as it amounted to 101% of the consensus estimate. This performance was supported by credit cost (CoC), credit growth, and Net Interest Margin (NIM) which were all in line with guidance. - NIM Target at 3.9-4.2% in 2025. NIM in 4Q24 stood at 3.9% (-17 bps YoY, -19 bps QoQ), so the NIM for 2024 decreased to 4.1% (-31 bps YoY) and was in line with management guidance in the range of 4.1-4.2%. Loan yield in 4Q24 was recorded at 8.23% (+9 bps YoY, -20 bps QoQ), continuing the quarterly downward trend since 1Q24. On the other hand, cost of fund (CoF) increased to 3.58% (+41 bps YoY, +12 bps QoQ) along with the company's strategy to secure liquidity by increasing the time deposit rate. This result also continues the upward trend of CoF since 3Q22. BNGA management targets NIM in the range of 3.9-4.2% in 2025, considering that CoF will remain high and loan yield will be difficult to increase. - CoC Target at Â±1% in 2025. CoC in 4Q24 was recorded at 0.8% (+26 bps YoY, -19 bps QoQ), so the CoC for 2024 was maintained at 0.8% (-19 bps YoY) and in line with management guidance targeting <1%. This is reflected in the -16% YoY decrease in provision expenses during 2024, although it rose +18% YoY in 4Q24 due to a low-base effect. In terms of asset quality, Gross Non-Performing Loans (NPL) and Loan-at-Risk (LAR) in 4Q24 decreased to 1.8% (-20 bps YoY) and 8.6% (-260 bps YoY) respectively. BNGA management targets stable CoC around 1% in 2025. - Credit Growth Target at +5-7% YoY in 2025. Credit growth reached +6.9% YoY in 2024 (vs. 2023: +8.5% YoY), at the upper limit of management guidance ranging from +5-7% YoY. Growth was primarily driven by the automotive segment (+26% YoY) and small-medium enterprises (+9.1% YoY). Meanwhile, third-party funds (DPK) grew +10.5% YoY in 2024 (vs. 2023: +3.8% YoY), marking the highest growth since 1Q22. Higher DPK growth than credit caused the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) to drop to 86.3% in 2024 (vs. 2024: 89.3%). BNGA management targets credit growth in the range of +5-7% YoY in 2025. - Dividend Payout Ratio 50% for 2024; 2025 Target up to 60%. BNGA management issued dividend payout ratio guidance for the 2024 fiscal year of 50% of the bank-only net profit (vs. 2023 fiscal year: 60%), indicating a dividend yield of 7.5% based on the price as of Thursday (20/2) at 1,720 rupiah per share. Going forward, BNGA management plans a dividend payout ratio of up to 60% for the 2025 fiscal year. Key Takeaway We assess BNGA's performance in 2024 as good, especially because NIM, CoC, and credit growth were in line with guidance, respectively. Furthermore, we consider the decrease in LDR as a plus point, considering the tight liquidity conditions seen in other banking issuers.

marketNews.title: FTSE Signals Re-evaluation of BREN Inclusion
marketNews.content: FTSE Russell Policy Director, Wanming Du, stated that Barito Renewables Energy can still be included in the FTSE index if it meets the criteria. Du explained that when determining FTSE index members, the main principles of FTSE Russell are transparency, investability, and replicability. FTSE also considers company size to ensure liquidity, as well as a minimum free float of 5%. Previously, BREN was removed from the FTSE Global Equity Series - Large Cap index by FTSE Russell in September 2024 due to issues with the free float rule following high shareholder concentration, where 97% of the total issued shares were only owned by 4 shareholders.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Current Account Deficit Widens to USD 8.9 Billion in 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's current account deficit reached 1.15 billion US dollars in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: deficit 1.38 billion US dollars, 3Q24: deficit 2.01 billion US dollars), marking the 7th consecutive quarterly deficit, although it was the smallest deficit in that period. This result caused Indonesia to experience a current account deficit of 8.9 billion US dollars throughout 2024, equivalent to 0.6% of GDP, widening from a deficit of 2 billion US dollars or 0.1% of GDP during 2023. Bank Indonesia itself projects the current account deficit in 2025 to be in the range of 0.5-1.3% of GDP.

marketNews.title: Government Signals Cancellation of Global Minimum Tax Implementation
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, signaled that the government is canceling the implementation of the 15% global minimum tax. Airlangga mentioned that they are currently considering global conditions and situations before implementing the policy. Airlangga also explained that they will likely follow the steps of US President Donald Trump, who withdrew from the global minimum tax agreement when signing several executive orders on January 21, 2025.

marketNews.title: OJK Confirms No Unusual Fund Withdrawals from State-Owned Banks Amid Himbara Withdrawal Calls
marketNews.content: Head of Banking Supervision OJK, Dian Ediana Rae, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that there have been no abnormally large fund withdrawals following calls to withdraw money from state-owned banks (Himbara). According to Dian, these calls are unnecessary to worry about. Meanwhile, Senior Vice President of the Indonesian Banking Development Institute, Trioksa Siahaan, mentioned that the calls to withdraw funds from Himbara banks reflect public concern regarding the Indonesian Investment Agency, similar to the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) investment body scandal case. Nevertheless, Trioksa asserted that these calls have no relation to public trust in Himbara banks, given that these banks are still growing well.

marketNews.title: Government Agrees to Implement Policy Banning Over Dimension and Overloading Trucks (ODOL)
marketNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that his ministry and the Ministry of Transportation agreed to implement a policy banning over dimension and overloading (ODOL) trucks. This step is aimed at improving traffic safety, although Agus did not specify when the new policy would be implemented. On the other hand, the Coordinator of the Indonesia Toll Road Watch, Deddy Herlambang, said that some parties still object to the policy because it could trigger inflation in industrial product prices, thus suggesting the government provide subsidies for logistics transportation.

marketNews.title: Toll Rate Discount of at Least 10% Confirmed for Eid al-Fitr 2025
marketNews.content: Director General at the Ministry of Public Works, Roy Rizali Anwar, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that the toll rate discount for Eid al-Fitr 2025 will be at least the same as the Christmas and New Year period, which is 10%. In a separate occasion, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, mentioned that a 10% discount program for plane tickets will be implemented one week before and after Eid al-Fitr 2025. President Prabowo Subianto confirmed earlier this week that the government will provide discounts on plane tickets and toll rates during Ramadan and Eid to boost economic growth during 1Q25.

tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) recorded a net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+7.6% YoY, -1.9% QoQ). Investors can continue to monitor BNGA's CoF developments in 2025, given its important role in forming NIM and the company's profitability.

tickerNews.title: FTSE Russell States BREN Can Still Enter FTSE Index If Criteria Are Met
tickerNews.content: Policy Director FTSE Russell, Wanming Du, stated that Barito Renewables Energy can still be included in the FTSE index if it meets the criteria. Du explained that when determining FTSE index members, the main principles of FTSE Russell are transparency, investability, and replicability. FTSE also considers company size to ensure liquidity, as well as a minimum free float of 5%. Previously, BREN was removed from the FTSE Global Equity Series - Large Cap index by FTSE Russell in September 2024 due to issues with the free float rule following high shareholder concentration, where 97% of the total issued shares were only owned by 4 shareholders.

tickerNews.title: Toyota Astra Motor is Ready to Produce Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) Locally
tickerNews.content: Head of Public Relations PT Toyota Astra Motor, Philardi Sobari, stated that they are ready to produce battery electric vehicles (BEV) domestically to make prices more affordable, although he did not elaborate further on when this plan would be realized. Philardi mentioned that based on guidance from the Toyota principal, all car models currently imported as completely built-up have the potential to be produced locally in Indonesia, including BEV, hybrid, plug-in hybrid, and internal combustion engine (ICE). Nevertheless, Philardi emphasized that Toyota's strategy in Indonesia towards electrification is a transition from ICE to hybrid. Previously, advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, claimed that Toyota Motor Corp. (TYO: 7203) intends to make Indonesia a manufacturing center for the southern region.

tickerNews.title: Agung Podomoro Land APLN Focuses on Building Ground Homes in 2025
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Agung Podomoro Land recorded marketing sales of approximately 1.9 trillion rupiah during 2024 (+54% YoY), indicating marketing sales in 4Q24 of approximately 530 billion rupiah (-8% QoQ, +79% YoY). APLN President Director, Bacelius Ruru, stated that the company will focus on the ground home segment in 2025, targeting the lower-middle market (prices of 200-500 million rupiah per unit). Nevertheless, Bacelius did not detail the marketing sales target for 2025.

tickerNews.title: ACES Records 3.4% YoY Same Store Sales Growth in January 2025
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +3.4% YoY in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: +7% YoY, January 2024: +5.6% YoY). The highest SSSG in January 2025 was recorded outside Java (+8.1% YoY), followed by Java outside Jakarta (+1.3% YoY) and Jakarta (-0.5% YoY). ACES also recorded a total of 246 stores as of January 2025, an increase of 1 store from the total stores at the end of 2024.

tickerNews.title: Bakrie & Brothers BNBR Reduces VKTR Stake After Selling 500 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas, Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR), sold 500 million VKTR shares at an average price of 100 rupiah per share on February 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 50 billion rupiah. After this transaction, BNBR's ownership in VKTR decreased from 30.41% to 29.26%.

tickerNews.title: PT Sigma Mutiara Sells 60 Million PBSA Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Paramita Bangun Sarana, PT Sigma Mutiara, sold 60 million PBSA shares at an average price of 334 rupiah per share on February 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 20 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Sigma Mutiara's ownership in PBSA decreased from 39.56% to 37.56%.

tickerNews.title: New CNKO Controller Plans Mandatory Tender Offer for 90% of Shares
tickerNews.content: The new controller of Exploitasi Energi Indonesia, Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd., plans to conduct a mandatory tender offer for 8.1 billion (90%) of CNKO shares at an offer price of 8 rupiah per share. This corporate action will take place from February 17 to March 18, 2025. This mandatory tender offer was conducted after Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. acquired 10% of CNKO shares worth approximately 6.3 billion rupiah or 7 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: China-Backed Nickel Smelter PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry Risks Shutdown
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry - which is one of the largest nickel smelter companies in Indonesia - has cut production and is on the verge of completely shutting down production. This news emerged just a few months after its parent company in China, Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry Co., went bankrupt. Bloomberg sources said that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry has delayed payments to local energy suppliers and cannot obtain nickel ore. PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry itself has a total nickel pig iron production capacity of 1.8 million tons per year, but Bloomberg sources stated that the company has shut down almost all of its production lines since early 2025.

tickerNews.title: Finance Ministry Signals Increased Budget to Support Prabowo's 3 Million Housing Program
tickerNews.content: Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that she, along with the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises and Bank Indonesia, will seek more adequate financing instruments to support the program of building 3 million houses per year. One of the options being reviewed is increasing the State Budget (APBN) support for the housing financing liquidity facility (FLPP) subsidy on a larger scale. In 2025, the APBN allocates 18 trillion rupiah for FLPP liquidity support and injects working capital to PT Sarana Multigriya Finansial to channel 220,000 housing loans for low-income communities with a loan interest rate of 5% for a 20-year tenor.

tickerNews.title: Finance Ministry Extends VAT and Luxury Goods Tax Incentives for Electric and Hybrid Vehicles
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Finance issued Finance Ministerial Regulation No. 12/2025 which will extend the Value Added Tax borne by the government (PPN DTP) incentive on the sale of electric motor vehicles, and the sales tax on luxury goods borne by the government (PPnBM DTP) on the sale of hybrid cars. This policy will be effective from February 4, 2025, until the end of 2025. The amount of the PPN DTP incentive for electric vehicle sales is the same as the previous policy, namely PPN DTP of 10% of the selling price for vehicles with a minimum domestic component level (TKDN) of 40%, and PPN DTP of 5% of the selling price for electric vehicles in the form of certain buses with a minimum TKDN of 20% up to less than 40%. Meanwhile, a PPnBM DTP incentive of 3% is granted for full hybrid, mild hybrid, and plug-in hybrid types of cars that meet the low-emission vehicle criteria in Government Regulation No. 74/2021.

tickerNews.title: Pertamina Targets 416,000 bopd Crude Oil Production in 2025, a 4% YoY Increase
tickerNews.content: Deputy President Director of PT Pertamina, Wiko Migantoro, stated on Thursday (20/2) that the company targets oil production of 416,000 barrels per day in 2025, a +4% YoY increase from the 2024 realization. Meanwhile, gas production is targeted to reach 2,536 MMSCFD, an increase of approximately +3% YoY from the 2024 realization. Besides the upstream sector, Pertamina also targets increased production in the refinery sector with a target reaching 334 million barrels of products in 2025, a +3% YoY increase compared to the 2024 realization, with the valuable product yield to be maintained at 83%.

tickerNews.title: Government to Provide 10% Plane Ticket Discount for Eid Homecoming
tickerNews.content: Director General at the Ministry of Public Works, Roy Rizali Anwar, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that the toll rate discount for Eid al-Fitr 2025 will be at least the same as the Christmas and New Year period, which is 10%. In a separate occasion, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, mentioned that a 10% discount program for plane tickets will be implemented one week before and after Eid al-Fitr 2025. President Prabowo Subianto confirmed earlier this week that the government will provide discounts on plane tickets and toll rates during Ramadan and Eid to boost economic growth during 1Q25.

tickerNews.title: East Ventures Plans to Bring a Portfolio Start-up to IPO with Valuation Over IDR 1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Co-founder and Managing Partner of East Ventures, Willson Cuaca, stated on Wednesday (19/2) that the company will bring one of the start-ups in its portfolio to IPO on the IDX with a value exceeding 1 trillion rupiah. Nevertheless, Willson could not specify the sector and the company yet. Katadata reported that several start-ups in East Ventures' portfolio, such as Fore Coffee and Sociolla, were rumored to be listing on the IDX.
